statements: SELECT * FROM ForecastingExpenses ORDER BY expense_date DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT id, expense_amount FROM ForecastingExpenses WHERE expense_amount > 1000
SELECT * FROM ForecastingExpenses ORDER BY id ASC LIMIT 5
SELECT id, expense_amount, expense_date FROM ForecastingExpenses WHERE expense_amount BETWEEN 500 AND 1000
SELECT * FROM ForecastingExpenses
SELECT * FROM ForecastingExpenses ORDER BY expense_date DESC, expense_amount ASC;
SELECT id, expense_amount FROM ForecastingExpenses WHERE expense_amount > 1000 ORDER BY expense_amount DESC;
SELECT expense_amount, expense_date FROM ForecastingExpenses WHERE expense_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-12-31';
SELECT id, expense_amount AS amount FROM ForecastingExpenses WHERE expense_amount < 500 ORDER BY id ASC;
SELECT * FROM ForecastingExpenses WHERE expense_date = '2022-08-15';
SELECT * FROM past_sql_records;
SELECT expense_amount, expense_category FROM past_sql_records ORDER BY expense_amount DESC;
SELECT * FROM past_sql_records WHERE expense_category = 'Food';
SELECT expense_date, expense_category, expense_amount FROM past_sql_records WHERE expense_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-02-28';
SELECT DISTINCT expense_category FROM past_sql_records;
SELECT * FROM past_sql_records ORDER BY expense_date DESC, expense_amount ASC LIMIT 5;
SELECT expense_category, AVG(expense_amount) FROM past_sql_records GROUP BY expense_category HAVING AVG(expense_amount) > 100;
SELECT * FROM past_sql_records WHERE expense_date BETWEEN '2021-01-01' AND '2021-12-31';
SELECT expense_amount, SUM(expense_amount) AS total_expenses FROM past_sql_records GROUP BY expense_amount HAVING SUM(expense_amount) > 500;
SELECT trend_type, SUM(trend_value) AS total_value FROM expense_trends GROUP BY trend_type;
SELECT * FROM expenses ORDER BY amount DESC;
SELECT category, amount FROM expenses WHERE date = '2022-01-10';
SELECT category, record_date FROM records WHERE amount > 1000 ORDER BY record_date ASC;
SELECT trend_id, category, prediction_date FROM trends WHERE average_amount >= 500 ORDER BY prediction_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM expenses WHERE category = 'Food' AND amount BETWEEN 10 AND 50 ORDER BY amount ASC;
SELECT * FROM expenses WHERE amount > 1000 ORDER BY date DESC;
SELECT category, AVG(amount) FROM expenses GROUP BY category HAVING AVG(amount) > 5000;
SELECT * FROM trends JOIN records ON trends.category = records.category WHERE trends.average_amount > records.amount;
SELECT category, MAX(amount) FROM expenses GROUP BY category ORDER BY MAX(amount) DESC;
SELECT category, SUM(amount) FROM expenses GROUP BY category HAVING SUM(amount) < 5000;
SELECT * FROM expenses ORDER BY date DESC
SELECT amount, category FROM expenses WHERE amount > 100 ORDER BY amount ASC
SELECT category, amount FROM expenses WHERE category = 'Food'
SELECT id, category FROM expenses WHERE date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-01-31'
SELECT * FROM expenses WHERE category LIKE '%entertainment%'
SELECT * FROM expenses WHERE category = 'Groceries' ORDER BY date DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT id, amount FROM expenses WHERE amount > 100 ORDER BY amount ASC
SELECT category, SUM(amount) AS total_amount FROM expenses GROUP BY category ORDER BY total_amount DESC
SELECT * FROM expenses WHERE date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-12-31'
SELECT category, COUNT(*) AS num_expenses FROM expenses GROUP BY category HAVING num_expenses > 5 ORDER BY num_expenses DESC
SELECT * FROM expenses;
SELECT expense_id, category FROM expenses WHERE expense_amount > 100;
SELECT expense_date, expense_amount FROM expenses ORDER BY expense_date DESC;
SELECT income_date, source FROM income WHERE income_amount < 500 ORDER BY income_date ASC;
SELECT trend_id, trend_date, trend_description FROM trends WHERE trend_id BETWEEN 10 AND 20;
SELECT * FROM expenses ORDER BY expense_date DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT expense_amount, category FROM expenses WHERE category='Groceries' AND expense_amount > 100 ORDER BY expense_amount DESC;
SELECT income_date, income_amount, source FROM income WHERE income_amount BETWEEN 500 AND 1000 ORDER BY income_date ASC;
SELECT forecast_date, forecast_amount, trend_description FROM forecasts JOIN trends ON forecasts.trend_id = trends.trend_id WHERE trend_description LIKE '%Sales%' ORDER BY forecast_amount DESC;
SELECT trend_date, trend_description FROM trends WHERE LENGTH(trend_description) < 50 ORDER BY trend_date DESC;
